definitions.text: a movable organ for flying (one of a pair)
one of the horizontal airfoils on either side of the fuselage of an airplane
a stage area out of sight of the audience
the side of military or naval formation
examples: they attacked the enemy's right flank

definitions.text: a hockey player stationed in a forward position on either side
(in flight formation) a position to the side and just to the rear of another aircraft
a group within a political party or legislature or other organization that holds distinct views or has a particular function
examples: they are the progressive wing of the Republican Party
he preferred the drumsticks to the wings

definitions.text: a barrier that surrounds the wheels of a vehicle to block splashing water or mud
examples: in Britain they call a fender a wing

definitions.text: an addition that extends a main building
travel through the air; be airborne
